statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Richmond 77, Seton Hall 71
article.story: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) -- Kevin Steenberge scored a career-best 30 points Friday night to lead Richmond to a 77-71 win over Seton Hall in the season opener for both teams at the Continental Airlines Arena. Steenberge, a junior center who had never before scored more than 12 points, was 11-for-13 from the field and 8-of-13 from the line. Daon Merritt had 19 points for Richmond, including the go-ahead free throw with 44 seconds remaining. Jermaine Bucknor added 12 points and nine rebounds. Kelly Whitney paced Seton Hall with 21 points. Richmond, which had not led since scoring the first basket of the game, rallied for take a 52-51 lead with 10:08 remaining when Bucknor hit a 3-pointer. Richmond maintained the advantage until Whitney hit one-of-two free throws to pull Seton Hall even at 68 with 1:47 left. The teams swapped 3-point plays with Merritt giving Richmond a 71-68 lead before John Allen countered for Seton Hall with 1:07 remaining. That set the stage for Merritt to give Richmond the lead with by missing the first but making the second of two free throws.
